alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 11:29AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, southwestern Clarendon, southwestern Sumter and eastern Orangeburg Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1129 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brookdale to near Bowman. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Brookdale, St. Matthews, Holly Hill, Summerton, Bowman, Elloree, Santee State Park, Santee Cooper Regional Airport, Santee, Pinewood, Cameron, Eutawville, Paxville, Vance, Poplar Creek Landing, Rimini, Stumphole Landing, Eautaw Springs, Blounts Landing and Lone Star. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 140 and 169. Interstate 95 between mile markers 85 and 117. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter
